snippet: In Chibok, Nigeria, where as many as 276 girls were taken by Boko Haram militants, a deep frustration is brewing over the slow government response.
abstract: Deep frustration is brewing among parents and others in Chibok, Nigeria, over government's slow response to kidnapping of more than 200 girls by militant group Boko Haram; search has so far been fruitless, despite international outpouring of logistical support; region has long born brunt of Boko Haram attacks, with several burnt-out schools dotting landscape near one where girls were captured.
lead_paragraph: In Chibok, Nigeria, where as many as 276 girls were taken by Boko Haram militants, a deep frustration is brewing over the slow government response.

headline.main: In Town of Missing Girls, Sorrow, but Little Progress
headline.print_headline: In Town of Missing Girls, Sorrow, but Little Progress
